Firstly, the user's question focuses on identifying who among two individuals present could be considered hardworking based solely on their past actions and contributions to tasks at hand. It appears that one individual (the older adult) has repeatedly shown up but failed to do any actual work while another person was extremely helpful in setting up an entire weekend event.

The context provided does not offer specific details about the nature of each task or how much effort went into them, nor is there information on whether these tasks were completed successfully or if they required significant time and energy. Therefore, it's challenging to make a definitive judgement based solely on what has been presented in this scenario.

However, given that one individual (the high schooler) was identified as having done actual work while the older adult did not do any real work according to the user’s description of events, we can infer from these contrasting actions and outcomes that it is more likely for someone who has completed tasks or made contributions in some way to be considered hardworking.
